title: E. O. Wilson
summary: Edward Osborne Wilson (born June 10, 1929), usually cited as E. O. Wilson, is an American biologist, naturalist, and writer. Wilson is an influential biologist[3][4][5] who on numerous occasions has been given the nicknames "The New Darwin", "Darwin's natural heir" or "The Darwin of the 21st century".[6][7][8] His biological specialty is myrmecology, the study of ants, on which he has been called the world's leading expert.[9][10][11]
